title: What are the seven wonders of the world and why are they considered to be 'wonders'? - Quora

response.answer_text: Because they were of such magnitude that it seemed that they were almost built by superhumans. Even today the Egyptian pyramids are thought by many modern people to have been built by aliens because they just can’t accept that ancient people built them. The original 7 wonders was a list compiled by ancient Greek philosophers. They are: The Great Pyramid of Giza, the Hanging Gardens of Babylon, he Temple of Artemis (Ephesus, and the statue of Zeus at Olympia,, the Tomb of Mausolus at Halicarnassus, the Colossus at Rhodes and the Lighthouse of Alexandria round out the list. Of all seven, only the Great Pyramid of Giza exists.
